text: We’ll hear arguments next in United States against Crews.
Thank you Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
Did not end on that date?
Did not end on that date.
Well, on that basis I suppose you could argue that you can never try a person after an illegal arrest?
In fairness to the Court of Appeals, I think the issue is a little bit more complicated than that because the court, I think suggests and odd believe respondents suggests --
You hope it isn’t, though, don’t you?
You may have an independent -- no, even if it is more complicated, we’re still going to win this case, I think.
That may be so, but you still have got him there by an illegal arrest.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
Couple of things, Mr. Chief Justice.
